original_title: Writing And Running Atari 2600 Games In Your Browser
original_content:
Here in 2024, writing new games for the venerable Atari 2600 game console is easier than ever, with plenty of emulators and toolchains to convert your code into ready-to-load ROMs. Yet what is easier than diving straight into 6502 assembly code without even having to download or set up a toolchain? Thats where [Henry Schmale]s fully in-browser Atari IDE and associated emulator (using the Javatari project) comes into play.
As [Henry] explains in a blog post, the main goal was to get a project working in Emscripten, the LLVM-based toolchain to create WebAssembly binaries with. The target of this became DASM, the macro assembler for a range of 8-bit MPUs, including the 6502. In the blog post [Henry] describes the general procedure for how he compiled and integrated DASM, as part of creating the earlier linked Atari 2600.
In this IDE a number of example programs are provided, which can be selected, assembled and run in the integrated Javatari instance. Beyond this you can write your own custom 6502 ASM, of course, but at this point you may be interested in taking things further with the versatile Stella emulator that can even run on platforms which youd be hard-pressed to get a browser running on, never mind Chromium.
title: アタリ2600コンソール向けの完全なブラウザベースのIDEとエミュレータが登場！
body: 2024年、Atari 2600用の新しいゲームを作成することが簡単になりました。[Henry Schmale]はブラウザ上で完全に使えるAtari IDEと関連するエミュレータを開発しました。さまざまな例のプログラムを組み立てて実行することができます。さらに、Stellaエミュレータも利用できます。

6502アセンブリコードの学習をブラウザ上ですぐに始められます
統合Javatariエミュレータで実行可能なサンプルプログラムが豊富に提供されます
DASMを使ったコンパイル手順の解説：アタリ2600の作成方法
ブラウザ上で実行可能なStellaエミュレータを活用して電子工作を楽しもう！
